page.title: 11Communications near Baldock
page.content:
Baldock was famous in the 18th century as a staging post for travellers up the Great North Road from London and today national coach companies still retain Baldock as a stop-off point from London to the North.
A daily coach route from Oxford to Cambridge also passes through Baldock.
Within the block, communications are very poor. Minor roads run through the block to villages outside it. They are narrow and twist about, probably following old enclosure boundaries.
There are only two telephone boxes and one post box outside Baldock!
